content: hey everyone why lock here welcome back
in episode 120 we made some really cool modular underdark themed tiles today
we're gonna spice them up a little by making some matching scatter terrain for
them we're gonna collect all sorts of bits to decorate with here's a bunch of
mushrooms I got these from Michael's where all the fairy house supplies are
just a few dollars a pack so that's worth it to me compared to like
sculpting or other wet work now we have a slick finish so I'm worried about
paint adhesion so I temporarily hot glued these to a slab of foam board took
it outside and primed them I used krylon matte black stalagmites gotta have
stalagmites channeling DM scotty yet again here mix up some white PVA glue
like Elmer's and some water fifty-fifty and then drenched some toilet paper in
it soak it wring it out and boom instant
fake clay just kind of form it to a point with your fingers stick it on your
mat and leave it 24 hours to dry come back and they should be rock-hard if
they aren't you didn't wring them out quite well enough seashells
again from the craft store all these are good but in particular I'm after these
small cup shaped ones extruded polystyrene or XPS this is 1 inch thick
home insulation from Lowe's just use your fingers and break off some pieces
to get nice rough edges and simulate boulders or go outside and pick up some
actual real rocks actually I think I'll use these instead pasta specifically
penne so you collect all this stuff and more get creative go wild assemble all
your features make piles of them for the base of the scatter train pieces you
could use foam board I usually do in fact this is exactly what I use back in
episode 110 for the industrial wreckage scatter and if you want to cut out the
base usually a small oval and then taper the edges like this with a fresh blade
so this right here makes a fine base and here's an example of a test piece I made
during R&D but I felt that for these I wanted something thinner lower profile
since they'll mostly be used on my tile set from episode 120 so instead I'm
using chipboard this is graphics medium chipboard been
using it on the channel for years link in the video description
if you want to get some this is just the greyish brownish stuff at the back of a
legal pad so I cut out a base and then just start hot gluing on different
features mix-and-match the pasta cut pretty easily and if it cracks
irregularly just try again on another one try and pick like two or three
features per base don't overwhelm them here they are built and then paint on
some white PVA glue to the base careful not to get it on your features just on
the ground and flock with pebbles and sand I've recently learned after
watching a lot of other terrain channels that having varying sized aggregate
makes for a better overall look so I'm doing some tiny pebbles here and then my
usual construction sand I recommend you just use the same color kit you did for
your under dark tile so that everything matches so for me started out with a
black base coat for the whole thing then a midnight blue heavy dry brush on all
the ground rocks and stalagmites
followed by a lighter dry brush with a rich aqua turquoise kind of color
including some edging nick around the perimeter of the base and along any
natural edges in your rocks and stalagmites then that minty greenish
blue kind of color just select a few spots with some light nicking and while
I was added a base coat at some of the mushrooms and the pasta with that color
as well the few that I didn't buy base coated with fuchsia from there I thought
I would experiment with wet blending I've never tried this before watched a
bunch of tutorials on YouTube gave it a go
tried it out did not go well kept experimenting and the following is what
I did it's not a true wet blend but from 12 inches away or further it looks like
a perfect glowing gradient so I got my base coated object such as a mushroom
took a different version of that color in this case it's that same turquoise
that I've been using apply some around the perimeter of the mushroom cap and
then fairly quickly before it starts to dry go flick the brush in water to clean
it out and at the same time load it with water then you come back and start
dabbing at the boundary just kind of working it dabbing maybe a tiny amount
of back-and-forth action if it turns into a mess right away then you have too
much water in the brush in that case wring out the water on the rim of your
cup before you start to do the blend same for the seashells except I went in
Reverse at base coated with a darker color and then blend it in the brighter
one outward from the heart of it these dried really nicely not professional or
anything but again from 12 inches away or further they really look like they're
glowing and lastly use the water product of your
choice to fill in the seashells I'm just using a cheap acrylic water kit I don't
even remember where I got it the brand is flora Kraft so I mixed up a capful
poured it in the shell to make a pool don't mix in paint or ink or other
colorants it'll affect the resin curing instead if you want the liquid to seem a
certain color paint that on the inside of the shell first like I did and we're
about to go to the table to see the final product but real quick some
reminders if you like what you're about to see please don't hesitate to hit that
like button subscribe reminders etc etc there is a link in the description below
from my Amazon storefront easy free way to support the channel if you want just
buy your stuff through that link and for all you 3d printers out there why LOX
crafting vids is sponsored by Heroes hoard which has an excellent range of
high quality models including but not limited to Altru tiles lines which are
open lock compatible also check out my modules over on the DMS guild and
remember $3 patrons get free copies of all my releases so I was getting ready
to kick off out of the abyss and I lost track of the days I ran out of time to
properly model velkan valve but this is a crude approximation of it and a good
enough opportunity to throw down the scatter and take a look at it really
interested in improving it blending I think that'd be a great tool for my
arsenal usually I go for like a wash and then highlight but such a new approach
and it's it has such a different look in real life than doing a wash oh if you
like these generic Mountain crag things I have those in a previous episode I'll
put a card on the screen one thought I had just a moment ago as I was recording
this narration was it would have been nice to paint little dots on the
mushroom caps and something I can go back and do later
and real quick let's revisit that footage from the end of episode 120 this
time focusing on the mushrooms and the scatter terrain again important to use
the same paints so that it kind of matches and at all jives feels like it's
part of it I'm happy with this project I've been
happy with lots of projects but this is the first time I can ever say that it
turned out exactly how my mind's eye had pictured it I've actually never been
able to achieve that before so very happy with us if you liked this
particular project here's two more that you should go check out right now also
enjoy this community showcase and don't forget to subscribe and click that bell
reminder icon I am why lock thanks for joining me and I'll see you next time
